content: Colette Linton-Meyer is the founder of Cobble Hill Ballet. Trained at the Royal Academy of Dance in London, England, Colette is a licentiate of the Royal Academy, which is recognized worldwide. She has been teaching this method of training for the past 21 years in New York and has trained dancers of all ages. Cobble Hill Ballet teaches Ballet and Modern Dance to Children, Teens and Adults at 2 locations on Columbia Street and Court Street.
name: Cobble Hill Ballet

content: NYC's best technology summer day camps: Coding, design, programming, game development, Minecraft modding and more for kids ages 7-14 in Brooklyn & Manhattan.
name: Pixel Academy

content: Calling all young scientists! Beat the summer heat and get into the lab! We offer 8 different week-long camp sessions covering a wide range of awesome science topics. Whether you’re a budding botanist, a future oceanographer, or you want to learn about the chemistry of cooking, we have something for you. One week, we’ll go for a ride on the science of roller coasters; another week we’ll learn about the forces behind superheroes’ special powers. And for the engineers of tomorrow, we’ll dive into optics and light, and study the incredible feats of engineering right here in Brooklyn. Even if it’s steamy and hot outside, camp with Carmelo the Science Fellow is always super-cool.
name: Carmelo The Science Fellow Summer Camp

content: Oasis Day Camp utilizes facilities at the newly completed, breathtaking Brooklyn Bridge Park. Oasis provides children with a fantastic opportunity to play and learn in the outdoors while staying close to home.   A traditional day camp in every way, Oasis in Brooklyn Bridge Park has everything a camp should; incredible grounds and facilities, loads of activities, and most importantly, the most well trained, caring staff in the industry.
name: Oasis Day Camp

content:
New Country Day Camp exists to preserve what might otherwise be lost in contemporary NYC: The peace one can only find in nature, the feeling of belonging to a close-knit community, unbridled joy and celebration of youth, and Jewish identity in harmony with the diversity of NYC and the world around us. New Country Day Camp is a program of the 14th Street Y of Educational Alliance.

Camp takes place on the beautiful Henry Kaufmann Campgrounds in Staten Island. Campers and staff ride to camp together on air-conditioned school buses from Brooklyn and Manhattan. Buses are a safe and fun part of camp, equipped with seatbelts and silliness. Various bus stops in Brooklyn Heights & Bococa.
name: New Country Day Camp

content: What will your child play this summer?  In our summer camps for ages 3-11, children learn the craft of acting from professional performers, and in doing so cultivate self-expression and artistry.
name: Child's Play NY

content:
Our Clay Camp is designed to provide children and young teens with fun and creative clay projects. They will learn to construct several clay
projects, to color and glaze them and to learn how to turn mud into magic. No prior pottery or clay experience is required. Our
ceramic art instructors are experienced artists and teachers who will work to help students have a meaningful and fun experience. Camp sessions are a week long, from Monday to Thursday,  and run from 9:30 to 12:30. The cost of one session is $325. This fee includes all materials, instruction, tools and firing.
name: Clayworks on Columbia

content: Packer Summer Camp is for boys and girls from 4 to 12 years old. 7:1 camper ratio. Outdoor play, air-conditioned indoor fun.
name: Packer Summer Camp

content: Children between the ages of 5 & 13 can experience a wonderful summer of dance, drama, music & art. The summer activities include:  field trips to various museums and events and projects that explore our weekly themes. The outstanding teaching artists of Creative Arts Studio will be teaching this multi-arts workshop in a fun and nurturing environment.
name: Creative Arts

content: The Dodge YMCA Summer Camp operates out of P.S. 261, located at 316 Pacific Street.
name: Dodge YMCA Summer Camp

content: Everyday Athlete Summer Camp is designed specifically to keep kids moving, playing and learning all Summer long. Designed by fitness experts and parents to promote health through dynamic exercise and most of all, FUN!
name: Everyday Athlete Summer Camp

content: As a premier Brooklyn summer camp, we know that the summer camp experience is one that stays with a child long after the final swim, camp song or friendship circle. In our 26 years of experience, we’ve watched our campers gain confidence, build leadership skills and approach their daily lives with a newfound sense of adventure and excitement.
name: Park Slope Day Camp

content: Food Art for Kids is a daily educational/instructional program for kids 5 to 11 years old. The program runs Monday through Friday, 9 am to 2:30 pm. After care can be arranged.  We are located at the Assumption Church in Brooklyn Heights   (55 Cranberry St).
name: Food For Art Cooking Camp

content: We offer 'Center Stage' camps for children aged 6-16 years and 'Theater Bugs' camps for children aged 4-6 years. Camps located in Cobble Hill, Carroll Gardens and Brooklyn Heights.
name: The Stage Theater Camp

content: Our fun and flexible camp let kids build kingdoms, strategize takeovers, save the planet and cure disease together, all by playing games! Kids love us because they have a blast, and parents love us because their children are developing critical cognitive and social skills for both school and everyday life. We offer Full Week, Individual Day, Half Day, Early Drop Off, and Extended Day registration options.
name: Brooklyn Strategist Summer Camp
